topic.title: Will there be any method to make ESP8266 to direct two separate antennas for its AP mode and STATION mode?
topic.body:
I'm still wondering. 
If there's some way to do this, it will be cool.

1542776840_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJV.body:
> [balancer73](#comment_4_1PniNzyi8fygvwyBaLpA9oBDVWZ5fXuJUw): They say it cannot be done at the Arduino IDE level, only at a lower level. Here is an example of a Wi-Fi project - a repeater on the ESP8266: [...]

Thanks for the link. I had already accomplished 2 to 4 levels of repeating with esp8266. But realized that without two uni-directional separate antennas the efficiency is too low. Of course this can be achieved by raspberry pi or any linux computer with the additional wifi usb card, but cost goes up rapidly..

1561453524_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body:
can't. 
You should destroy the current plug assembly inside and wire again.
Because headphone jack triggers the physical switch inside the jack hole, and then the switch turns off the internal speaker while accepting signal from the headphone wire.
Of course, bluetooth setup could bypass such a tricky method, but a bit annoying with threatening electromagnetic wave, etc.
